resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
JabariBooker opened a new pull request, #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051

   Adding validation for HashJoinNodeOptions

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#issuecomment-1115490983

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

lidavidm commented on PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#issuecomment-1116309424

   General comment: can we also add a few short unit tests to test this validation?

vibhatha commented on code in PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#discussion_r866889090


##########
cpp/src/arrow/compute/exec/hash_join_node.cc:
##########
@@ -453,6 +453,20 @@ Status HashJoinSchema::CollectFilterColumns(std::vector<FieldRef>& left_filter,
   return Status::OK();
 }
 
+Status ValidateHashJoinNodeOptions(const HashJoinNodeOptions& join_options) {
+  if (join_options.key_cmp.size() < 1 || join_options.left_keys.size() < 1 ||
+      join_options.right_keys.size() < 1) {

Review Comment:
   Nit: Wouldn't it be better to call `empty()` on vectors?
   
   For instance:
   
   ```c++
   if (join_options.empty()  || join_options.left_keys.empty() < 1 ||  join_options.right_keys.empty())
   ```

vibhatha commented on code in PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#discussion_r866889090


##########
cpp/src/arrow/compute/exec/hash_join_node.cc:
##########
@@ -453,6 +453,20 @@ Status HashJoinSchema::CollectFilterColumns(std::vector<FieldRef>& left_filter,
   return Status::OK();
 }
 
+Status ValidateHashJoinNodeOptions(const HashJoinNodeOptions& join_options) {
+  if (join_options.key_cmp.size() < 1 || join_options.left_keys.size() < 1 ||
+      join_options.right_keys.size() < 1) {

Review Comment:
   Nit: Wouldn't it be better to call `empty()` on vectors?
   
   For instance:
   
   ```c++
   if (join_options.key_cmp.empty()  || join_options.left_keys.empty() ||  join_options.right_keys.empty())
   ```

westonpace commented on PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#issuecomment-1121774378

   Also, I agree with David's comment, can we add a quick unit test?

lidavidm commented on PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#issuecomment-1148559658

   Hmm, the docs CI is persistently failing. Do you mind rebasing @JabariBooker?

JabariBooker commented on PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#issuecomment-1149244265

   > Hmm, the docs CI is persistently failing. Do you mind rebasing @JabariBooker?
   
   @lidavidm Seems to have fixed the issue. Now there are failures for `TestS3FS` and `TestS3FSGeneric` due to an IOError.

lidavidm commented on PR #13051:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13051#issuecomment-1149803066

   Thanks!

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: At the very least key_cmp needs to match the number of join columns, there may be other invariants to uphold. Probably all the ones from the [semi-join PR|https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10845/files#diff-1028a02ecee91ae8a9fbb7318e1ce650760716d317457d48e0740c802287fbdbR38]: there must be the same, non-zero number of keys on both sides.
